result.execSummary:
The defendant Martha L Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: the sentence imposed as to Count 2.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Part-time employment or meaningful volunteer work - if able to do so.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim without the agent's approval.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.

AODA assessment and comply with any treatment.
Absolute Sobriety.
Random screens.

timeConds.notes: Stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martha L Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martha L Carter in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
At the request of the agent, the 11/06/15 probation review is rescheduled to 12/04/15 at 1:30 pm.  rmm
Bail Refund Check Packet
Bail Refund Check Packet
Mail notice and affidavit mailed to surety on 08/28/2015.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis - if not already done so

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 2; credit for 28 days served.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9  MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; credit for 28 days served.

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18  MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Court ordered 45 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No contact with the victim without the agent's approval
- Part-time employment or meaningful volunteer work - if able to do so
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015

Appeal rights given.

As to Amended Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Martha L Carter in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State files Amended Information with the Court.
Count 1:  Child Neglect, a Class A misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a)
Count 2:  Obstructing An Officer, a Classs A misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a)

Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated June 30, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

15RM035254  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/26/2015

Violation Report received from Justice Point, received and filed.
Branch 4 reviewed violation for Branch 40.  Due to the unavailability of the court to reach defense counsel, voice mail was full, no action was taken by this court.  Violation can be addressed by the the court on 8-3-2015, the calendared date for the Plea and Sentencing Hearing for case.    mld
The $2500.00 on deposit remains.  Defendant to post another $1000.00.  ALL CONDITIONS REMAIN.

Defendant Martha L Carter in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz who appeared via telephone.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Court in receipt of violation report.  Defendant tested positive for THC again.  Argument heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail set at $3500.00.  Case remains set for plea and sentencing on 8/03/15.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Martha L Carter in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Court admonished the defendant regarding her positive test for THC and advised her that any further positive tests may result in higher cash bail.  Court will take  13CM3503 for resolution only.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Martha L Carter in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court admonished the defendant regarding her positive THC test and advised her that any further positive tests will result in higher cash bail.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.B. (8/15/14) OR MONTAY B-O.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Martha L Carter in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Martha L Carter in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
